rules.natural: If trade1 is profitable, then the goal is achieved for strategy1.
Provided that publication news1 is positive, if a condition is met for strategy1, the goal is achieved for strategy1.
Either publication news1 is positive or publication news2 is negative.
Assuming the price drops for stock1, then if a condition is met for strategy1, the goal is achieved for strategy1.
Given that game theory is applied to strategy1, then if publication news2 is negative, the price drops for stock1.
If the margin increases for account1, then account1 holds a liquid position.
Provided that option1 is profitable, the goal is achieved for strategy1.
Option1 is profitable or future1 is profitable.
Assuming the risk is high for strategy1, a stop loss is set for strategy1.
Provided that leverage is reduced for account1, then if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.
If a stop loss is set for strategy1, then leverage is reduced for account1.
Given that technical signal1 indicates a buy, momentum signal3 indicates a buy.
Technical signal1 indicates a buy or fundamental signal2 indicates a buy.
In case fundamental signal2 indicates a buy, trade1 is profitable.
Assuming momentum signal3 indicates a buy, trade1 is profitable.
If a margin breach occurs for account1, then a margin call occurs for account1.
Provided that collateral is insufficient for account1, a margin breach occurs for account1.
Whenever an arbitrage opportunity exists in period1, price convergence occurs for assets1.
Either an arbitrage opportunity exists in period1 or if publication news2 is negative then the price drops for stock1.
Given that a market crash happens in period1, then if it is not the case that the goal is achieved for strategy1, account1 holds a liquid position.
If trade1 is executed in period1, then trade2 is profitable.
Trade1 is executed in period1 or trade2 is executed in period1.
Either market recovery occurs in period1 or a market crash happens in period1.
Provided that broker1 is regulation compliant, it is not the case that market recovery occurs in period1.
If broker1 passes an audit, then broker1 is regulation compliant.
Broker1 passes an audit or broker1 holds a valid license.
Whenever broker1 holds a valid license, broker1 is regulation compliant.

In case the volatility index is high for vix1, then either a circuit breaker is triggered for exchange1 or if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.
The volatility index is high for vix1 or trading is halted on exchange1.

Assuming trading is halted on exchange1, then either a circuit breaker is triggered for exchange1 or if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.

Either insider trading is detected for trader1 or if the risk is high for strategy1 then if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.
Provided that a whistleblower report is filed, an investigation is opened by regulator1.
A whistleblower report is filed or suspicious activity is flagged.
Whenever suspicious activity is flagged, it is not the case that insider trading is detected for trader1.
Given that the market is volatile during period1, then if it is not the case that if trade2 is executed in period1 then trade1 is profitable, a margin call occurs for account1.
In case the market is stable during period1, then if it is not the case that if trade2 is executed in period1 then trade1 is profitable, a margin call occurs for account1.
Assuming it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, it is not the case that the position is closed for account1.
Whenever it is not the case that if trade2 is executed in period1 then trade1 is profitable, collateral is insufficient for account1.
In case it is not the case that if trade2 is executed in period1 then trade1 is profitable, it is not the case that a margin call occurs for account1.
Provided that it is not the case that the market is volatile during period1 or the market is stable during period1, the margin is sufficient for account1.
Assuming it is not the case that the goal is achieved for strategy1, the margin increases for account1.
Whenever it is not the case that the goal is achieved for strategy1, it is not the case that account1 holds a liquid position.

(A1 → G).natural: If trade1 is profitable, then the goal is achieved for strategy1.

(A10 → (A9 → G)).natural: Provided that publication news1 is positive, if a condition is met for strategy1, the goal is achieved for strategy1.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either publication news1 is positive or publication news2 is negative.

(A11 → (A9 → G)).natural: Whenever publication news2 is negative, then if a condition is met for strategy1, the goal is achieved for strategy1.

(A11 → A12).natural: In case publication news2 is negative, the price drops for stock1.

(A12 → (A9 → G)).natural: Assuming the price drops for stock1, then if a condition is met for strategy1, the goal is achieved for strategy1.

(A13 → (A11 → A12)).natural: Given that game theory is applied to strategy1, then if publication news2 is negative, the price drops for stock1.

(A15 → A14).natural: If the margin increases for account1, then account1 holds a liquid position.

(A16 → G).natural: Provided that option1 is profitable, the goal is achieved for strategy1.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Option1 is profitable or future1 is profitable.

(A17 → G).natural: Whenever future1 is profitable, the goal is achieved for strategy1.

(A19 → (¬(A17 → G) → A18)).natural: If the risk is high for strategy1, then if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.

(A19 → A20).natural: In case the risk is high for strategy1, leverage is reduced for account1.

(A19 → A21).natural: Assuming the risk is high for strategy1, a stop loss is set for strategy1.

(A2 ∨ A1).natural: Either trade2 is profitable or trade1 is profitable.

(A20 → (¬(A17 → G) → A18)).natural: Provided that leverage is reduced for account1, then if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.

(A21 → A20).natural: If a stop loss is set for strategy1, then leverage is reduced for account1.

(A22 → A1).natural: Whenever technical signal1 indicates a buy, trade1 is profitable.

(A22 → A24).natural: Given that technical signal1 indicates a buy, momentum signal3 indicates a buy.

(A22 ∨ A23).natural: Technical signal1 indicates a buy or fundamental signal2 indicates a buy.

(A23 → A1).natural: In case fundamental signal2 indicates a buy, trade1 is profitable.

(A24 → A1).natural: Assuming momentum signal3 indicates a buy, trade1 is profitable.

(A25 → A5).natural: If a margin breach occurs for account1, then a margin call occurs for account1.

(A26 → A25).natural: Provided that collateral is insufficient for account1, a margin breach occurs for account1.

(A27 → A28).natural: Whenever an arbitrage opportunity exists in period1, price convergence occurs for assets1.

(A27 ∨ (A11 → A12)).natural: Either an arbitrage opportunity exists in period1 or if publication news2 is negative then the price drops for stock1.

(A29 → (¬G → A14)).natural: Given that a market crash happens in period1, then if it is not the case that the goal is achieved for strategy1, account1 holds a liquid position.

(A3 → A2).natural: If trade1 is executed in period1, then trade2 is profitable.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Trade1 is executed in period1 or trade2 is executed in period1.

(A30 ∨ A29).natural: Either market recovery occurs in period1 or a market crash happens in period1.

(A31 → ¬A30).natural: Provided that broker1 is regulation compliant, it is not the case that market recovery occurs in period1.

(A32 → A31).natural: If broker1 passes an audit, then broker1 is regulation compliant.

(A32 ∨ A33).natural: Broker1 passes an audit or broker1 holds a valid license.

(A33 → A31).natural: Whenever broker1 holds a valid license, broker1 is regulation compliant.

(A34 ∨ (¬(A17 → G) → A18)).natural: Either a circuit breaker is triggered for exchange1 or if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.

(A35 → (A34 ∨ (¬(A17 → G) → A18))).natural: In case the volatility index is high for vix1, then either a circuit breaker is triggered for exchange1 or if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.

(A35 ∨ A36).natural: The volatility index is high for vix1 or trading is halted on exchange1.

(A36 → (A34 ∨ (¬(A17 → G) → A18))).natural: Assuming trading is halted on exchange1, then either a circuit breaker is triggered for exchange1 or if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.

(A37 ∨ (A19 → (¬(A17 → G) → A18))).natural: Either insider trading is detected for trader1 or if the risk is high for strategy1 then if it is not the case that if future1 is profitable then the goal is achieved for strategy1, the position is closed for account1.

(A38 ∨ ¬A37).natural: An investigation is opened by regulator1 or it is not the case that insider trading is detected for trader1.

(A39 → A38).natural: Provided that a whistleblower report is filed, an investigation is opened by regulator1.

(A39 ∨ A40).natural: A whistleblower report is filed or suspicious activity is flagged.

(A4 → A1).natural: If trade2 is executed in period1, then trade1 is profitable.

(A40 → ¬A37).natural: Whenever suspicious activity is flagged, it is not the case that insider trading is detected for trader1.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: The market is volatile during period1 or the market is stable during period1.

(¬(A4 → A1) → A25).natural: If it is not the case that if trade2 is executed in period1 then trade1 is profitable, a margin breach occurs for account1.

(¬(A6 ∨ A7) → A8).natural: Provided that it is not the case that the market is volatile during period1 or the market is stable during period1, the margin is sufficient for account1.

(¬G → A14).natural: If it is not the case that the goal is achieved for strategy1, account1 holds a liquid position.

(¬G → A15).natural: Assuming it is not the case that the goal is achieved for strategy1, the margin increases for account1.
